Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2007 02:10PM redbirdgirl wrote: About the headaches. After a rough first chemo (port in the same morning, got deydrated and spent a couple of days in the hospital), the second one was so much better, but I did get a nasty headache again. This time I took my usual migraine medicine (Zomig) and it worked like a champ. Zomig is a little old-fashioned as migraine meds go, but it works for me. I wonder if your dr wouldn't give you something specifically strong for headaches.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in JAN 2007 Robbin65 Robbin65
Starting Chemo in JAN 2007 Robbin65 Robbin65

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2007 06:20PM redbirdgirl wrote: Good news and bad (not so bad, really) news. Went in for my first chemo this morning and the dr decided to put it off a week as they had not gotten me in for a port yet and my veins are subpar (I've had a lot of complaints over the years) but on the good, good, good side, the results of my petscan were fine. Whew. Since I still am having the leg pain, they are doing a bone scan, but I really don't think they are thinking mets. so big whew.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in JAN 2007 Robbin65 Robbin65

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2007 11:19AM redbirdgirl wrote: Watch out for those dry eyes. I accidently got something in my eye (eye shadow, I think, to make up for the eyelashlessness). Without the tears, my cornea was scratched. Talk about painful! So, eyedrops yes-- eye makeup no!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in JAN 2007 Robbin65 Robbin65

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2007 06:25AM redbirdgirl wrote: Kathy, Not to be negative, because I don't think it's usually the case, but a pain like the one you describe is what led to my diagnosis. I'd skipped more than one mammogram, but having a symptom got my attention. I worried that it might be very advanced since there was some pain, but that was not the case. I hope yours turns out to be nothing, but I am glad that I had some symptoms or I might still be letting things go instead of paying attention and taking care of things. Good luck to you. Kay
